title: Indifferent Players
body:
Hey Everyone,

So I'm sure quite a few of you would have come across a player who says something like "It's only a game, don't take it so seriously".
This is usually, for me at least, after giving them a helpful tip such as "You need to be more map aware :)" which could have won the skirmish.

It's not that I take the game seriously, but the idea of the game is to have _fun_ , and that kinda gets ruined when a player just doesn't care.
Other comments such as "It's just norms, idgaf", "this is just a game, get a life", "something something ya mum".

My usual answer is, If you don't care about the game and fun, why are you playing it?
To which they usually answer "have a cry, etc". LOL.

So, what are your opinions about the game? About indifferent players? How do you respond to those players? Do nothing/Mute/Report/Help enemy team kill them? ha ha
Do you take the game ultra seriously? To have fun? Or just to troll?

Comment Below~!

- CyanShinobi

replies.body:
a good portion of OCE has a attitude problem, its slowly being addressed. 

alot of the time tho, those sorts of players tend to use that as an excuse for their bad play, rather then accept they made a mistake.

i say nothing after they make this statement and just report them for neg attitude at post.

I agree. They normally are having a bad game, so get defensive when offered advice, because they see it as an insult.
Yes, I usually mute them and then report them for neg attitude as well. :)

If it's a normal or ARAM I'm honestly not too bothered. If I do say something, I always word it carefully cause I know some people do take offense easily. I say something like "Just so you know for next time :^)"
If they take it the wrong way then screw 'em, that's not your problem you're only trying to help!
Most of the time I find people are like "Oh, right!" or "Awesome thanks" and it makes it feel worth it to me.
Most. Definitely not all of the time! lol

Yeah I sometimes get a "oh I didn't know! Thanks!".
Getting all those bad replies is sometimes worth getting that one good reply :)

I personally always appreciate the good advice..  Like once upon a time I had no idea Caitlyn's net can launch me through walls. Ever since someone's told me I think it's saved my life on about 4-5 occasions since then?
So people need to keep that shiz up ðŸ˜

I agree. Sometimes I'm like, I know how to play this champ, but I still listen to advice if it's constructive. Like for me I forgot how to build Diana cuz I hadn't used her in soooo long, and someone said "why haven't you got a {{item:3115}}  yet?" And I was like "OH YEAHHHHH! *facepalm* :P

So yeah, constructive criticism~! Keep it up~!

Most of the time I find it's easier to just let it go, if someone doesn't know how something works then I'll help them out but otherwise more people take offense than actually care for advice.

On the other hand though, there are some people that take this game *way* too seriously! I play to have a bit of fun, but at the same time I do try and keep a civil attitude - a bit of friendly banter is always fun too. Don't push people who are there to have fun (unless it's ranked I guess, I only play norms), but it is worth making a bit of a point to people that ruin the fun, if all it does is start a fight though, just drop it and fountain dive! (just kidding)
